body_html:
Hmm..not really, because what I'm looking at is the clone_model provided by keras. I doubt it's because when clone model is created by passing in input_tensor, the _feed_inputs is lost, making "updates += self.get_updates_for(self._feed_inputs)" not adding any update ops inside _make_train_function.
On the other hand, when clone model is created without input_tensor, it will create a placeholder on its own, thus fulfilling _feed_inputs.
I will update when I have more info.

body:
Hmm..not really, because what I'm looking at is the clone_model provided by keras. I doubt it's because when clone model is created by passing in input_tensor, the _feed_inputs is lost, making "updates += self.get_updates_for(self._feed_inputs)" not adding any update ops inside _make_train_function.
On the other hand, when clone model is created without input_tensor, it will create a placeholder on its own, thus fulfilling _feed_inputs.
I will update when I have more info.
